intro: Psoralidium stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psoralidium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves contain compounds that may have medicinal properties, though further research is needed. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
